hints.content:
The area is the number of $1 \times 1$ squares the shape covers.

 Let's count the number of squares covered in each shape to find which shape has an area of $14$ square units.

[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $13$ square units, not $14$ square units.

options.alt:
A shape with 10 sides is made up of 13 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, starting from the top in a clockwise pattern, 3 squares to the right, 2 squares down, 2 squares to the left, 1 square down, 2 squares to the right, 1 square down, 4 squares to the left, 3 squares up, 1 square to the right, 1 square up.

Each square is counted inside the shape from 1 to 13. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $10$ square units, not $14$ square units.

options.alt:
A shape with 6 sides is made up of 10 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, starting from the top in a clockwise pattern, 1 square to the right, 7 squares down, 4 squares to the left, 1 square up, 3 squares to the right, 6 squares up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 10. !

hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]

This shape has an area of $14$ square units.

options.alt:
A shape with 12 sides is made up of 14 squares is drawn on a grid. The length of each side is as follows, starting from the top in a clockwise pattern, 3 squares to the right, 4 squares down, 1 square to the left, 1 square down, 1 square to the left, 1 square up, 4 squares to the left, 2 squares up, 1 square to the left, 1 square up.

Each square inside the shape is counted from 1 to 14. !

question.content:
**Which shape below has an area of $14$ square units?**

[[☃ image 1]]

 is $1$ square unit.

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A square is equal to 1 square unit. !
